Trump admin proposing tariffs on goods from countries found to have undervalued currencies in a move that would further escalate its assault on global trading rules The proposal would let USbased companies seek antisubsidy tariffs on products from countries found by the US Treasury Dept to be engaging in competitive devaluation of their currencies Currently no country in the world meets that criteria The move aimed at China Germany South Korea Japan India Switzerland is likely to provoke controversy among foreign allies and could result in challenges at the WTO The rule change could generate 39M21M in additional duties collected each year if taken to its fullest extentUUP FXE FXY FXF VIXTrumpTariffTantrumShow More
